meanings.definition: To assign too much work or responsibility to (someone)
meanings.sent1: The teacher overtasks the students with homework every day.
meanings.sent2: She always overtasks herself with chores and errands.
meanings.sent3: When the robot overtasks itself, it starts malfunctioning.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world overtasks her shoulders, but she carries on.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending to-do list overtasks her mind, making it hard to relax.

meanings.definition: To burden with excessive demands or tasks
meanings.sent1: The manager overtasks his employees with unrealistic deadlines.
meanings.sent2: Being a perfectionist, she often overtasks herself with projects.
meanings.sent3: The computer overtasks itself and crashes during the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: The heavy workload overtasks her, leaving her exhausted at the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The constant requests overtasks his patience, causing him to snap.
